Name: Sector
Definition: Sectors, industries and subdivisions selected as relevant to legal work

children.Name: Energy
children.Notes on definition: Aggregation of upstream oil and gas (extraction), generation and supply of energy and its transportation
children.Relationship with NACE: Aggregation of division 6 (extraction of oil and gas) and section D (energy supply) together with elements of distribution, retail and transportation (sections G and H)

children.Name: Consumer goods
children.Notes on definition: Manufacture, distribution and sale of products targeted at consumers with relatively low cost, including fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), i.e. those which are purchased and consumed regularly
children.Relationship with NACE: Aggregation of elements from sections C (manufacturing) and G (wholesale and retail trade)

children.Name: Mobility
children.Notes on definition: Manufacture, distribution, sale and repair of vehicles; construction and maintenance of transport infrastructure; operation of transport services
children.Relationship with NACE: Aggregation of  divisions 29 and 30 (vehicle manufacture) with elements of division 42 (infrastructure), section H (transportation) and section T  (services, including vehicle rental)

children.Name: Fintech
children.Notes on definition: Financial services delivered primarily using technology, and the technology itself
children.Relationship with NACE: Aggregation of elements from divisions 58.29, 62 and 63 (software) with section L (financial)
